forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. West southwest wind around 12 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Light Rain then Mostly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 11am. Mostly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 58 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 12 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the early hours of the morning, Downtown San Francisco wakes under a mostly cloudy sky with a gentle breeze whispering through the streets. The atmosphere carries a hint of moisture, teasing a slight chance of rain that may add a soft sparkle to the pavements by dawn. As the day unfolds, expect glimpses of sunshine piercing through the clouds, heralding a more pleasant afternoon. The temperature will be moderate, cooling subtly as the day wanes, perfect for light layering.

Fog, a quintessential companion to the bay, might linger at the edges, veiling the Golden Gate Bridge in a ghostly embrace while the city itself remains distinctly clear. One might choose to venture into the world with a light sweater and perhaps a rain jacket just in case. A leisurely stroll along the waterfront seems fitting, perhaps indulging in a moment of quiet reflection or enjoyment of a warm cup from a nearby café. Embrace this serene yet dynamic day, letting the unique San Francisco atmosphere envelop you.
